organic_results.title: The unfulfilled promise of cultural capital theory
organic_results.snippet: Bourdieu's ideas about the role of cultural capital in schools enjoy great currency, but this acceptance proceeds without due scrutiny of the related empirical research. A review of this research indicates that (1) defined in terms of exclusionary class-related practices and dispositions, cultural capital does not substantially account for the relationship between social privilege and academic success, and (2) too many conceptually distinct variables have been labeled cultural capital, creating a distorted sense of what accounts for academic …
